intro: Thesidium hirtum, commonly known as the hairy thesidium, is a small, herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels, a common floral arrangement in the carrot family. Thesidium hirtum typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
